ProdigyAnswered on 23 Aug 2019Hi there, if you feel he needs additional hospital coverage and the family is able to share the cost on it well.I've got a summary premium calculator that you can use for free over here https://www.theastuteparent.com/2017/04/integrated-shield-plan-calculator-comparison/From my experience with private client's parents, there is usually certain health history. For certain chronic conditions, Raffles Shield can be a solution of coverage. At an older age, premiums are higher and some prefer to insure with the NTUC Incomeshield with a 10% co-payment rider to be more cost-effective.
Reach us at https://www.facebook.com/TheAstuteParent/ if you have further questions. Take care0 comments0
